Events that occurred on 30 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1923 - Musician Donald Swann is born.
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 82.
1946 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 106.
1947 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 111a.
1947 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Rosemary.
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 170.
1963 - Music producer Carvin Knowles is born.
1964 - Actor Bernard Rebel dies.
1979 - Oxonmoot 1979 at the Eastgate Hotel.
1997 - The album An Evening in Rivendell is released.
2000 - J.R.R. Tolkien and His Literary Resonances is published.
2010 - Jubilee for Mithlond, the Gothenburg Tolkien Society of Sweden.
2014 - Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor is released in North America.
2022 - The episode Ud√ªn of The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power is released online.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Crickhollow is raided by three Black Riders in the early hours and Fatty Bolger alerts the village. The Black Riders run away.
The Inn at Bree is simultaneously raided but the Black Riders find only pillows in the Hobbits' beds. The ponies are lost.
Frodo and his companions buy Bill the Pony from Bill Ferny and leave Bree together with Strider.
Gandalf comes to Crickhollow and sees Frodo's cloak outside. Losing hope, he reaches Bree at night. He meets Barliman Butterbur who apologises and tells him the Hobbits left with Strider.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
